Utilities

Class Vector2

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.Vector2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Vector3

    public class Vector2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A useful class with an X, Y and length. Also has many other useful methods for physics.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors

      Default Constructor.

      Creates a new Vector2 out of an X and Y
      Vector2(Matrix v)
      A constructor which uses a matrix holding a vertical matrix vector.
      Vector2(java.awt.Point p)
      Creates a Vector2 out of a point
      Vector2(Vector2 v)
      creates a new Vector2 out of an old Vector2

      • reset

        public void reset(double x,
         double y)
        Resets the Vector using the new double values. Its like a new Constructor without creating a different instance
        Parameters:
        x - the new X value
        y - the new Y value

      • length

        public double length()
        the Length of the Vector. Imagine the X and Y as legs of a Right Triangle. Length is the Hypotenuse
        Returns:
        the Length of the Vector

      • getScalarMultiple

        public double getScalarMultiple(Vector2 o)
        This method will return to the user the Scalar Multiple which turns this Vector into the passed in Vector. If no scalar multiple exists, then returns a 0.
        Parameters:
        o - Vector this vector becomes when multiplied by a scalar multiple.
        Returns:
        The scalar multiple, or 0 if no scalar multiple exists.
